intro: Acerates schaffneri, commonly known as the Schaffner's acerates, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its unique leaf morphology, featuring lobed leaves with a distinctive serrated edge. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring, followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Native to specific regions in South America, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
